content.description:
Starts to the left of the belayer on easy moves to the second bolt before getting a little more technical into the crux to the ledge on insecure moves. Climb up to the roof, move left then pull the roof and move back right, then climb straight up to the anchors. This route shares the roof section and anchors with the route "Plastic Dashboard Jesus". Located on The Upper Deck ledge, accessible from first pitch of "Total Landscaping". First route to the left of and shares belay station with pitch 2 of "Total Landscaping"

Rappel the whole route with a 70m rope Bolted belay station and bolts to rap anchors

An tricky boulder problem off the deck leads to easier climbing above. There is usually a jug available, and if not there is one close by, just keep moving up! The right-most climb (looking at the wall) 17 bolts, plus anchor w/ rings

A 70m rope required for routes on this wall

Start up with easy moves then traverse left before moving up on thin holds into a scoop with good rests. Climb through the crux with positive 2 pad jug and smearing, then past insecure moves before pulling the roof to the anchor.



The leftmost route on The Upper Deck ledge, accessible from first pitch of "Total Landscaping", this route shares a belay station and first bolt with "Plastic Dashboard Jesus". Reach the belay station by passing the anchors at the top of the access pitch(P1 of Total Landscaping) and traversing left across the ledge. Stay protected at all times while on the ledge! You can rap to the ground with a 70m rope, but be very careful of rockfall especially when pulling the rope. Alternatively, use Four Seasons belay station as intermediate rap station.

Bolted belay and bolts to rap ring anchors

Easy climbing up the the broken flake feature, past the crux with insecure moves, up and over the roof to the anchors.



Located on The Upper Deck ledge, between "My Roof My Rules" and "Four Seasons" accessible from first pitch of "Total Landscaping", this route shares a belay station and first bolt with "My Roof My Rules". Reach the belay station by passing the anchors at the top of the access pitch(P1 of Total Landscaping) and traversing left across the ledge. Stay protected at all times while on the ledge! You can rap to the ground with a 70m rope, but be very careful of rockfall especially when pulling the rope. Alternatively, use Four Seasons belay station as intermediate rap station.

Bolted belay, bolts to rap ring anchor

Great climbing with a lot of variety! The main crux is the slab at about 1/3rd height, although there are two more distinct cruxes higher up.  Start in the dirty corner for a few moves before moving onto main slab/face. The leftmost route when looking up 21 bolts, plus anchor w/ rappel rings

A 70m rope required for routes on this wall

P1 - Used as access to "The Upper Deck" - Start up easy, dirty climbing to high first bolt and continue up slabby face through short crux, to the ledge. 5.8- 14m

P2 - Start on small feet into nice face climbing before pulling the crux roof on good jugs and reaching the anchors. 5.9 17m

You can easily reach the ground on a single rappel with 70m rope and possibly on a 60m, although it may require a short easy downclimb.



About 10-15m to the right of the main belay ledge at the Sunwall. 

Bolts with rap rings

Sustained and insecure for most of its length. Tiny feet and hands up high with a crux that involves moving from an under cling up onto a blank slab.  The center of the three bolted lines At least 16 bolts, plus anchor w/ rings

A 70m rope required for routes on this wall

Lots of afternoon sunshine at the Sunwall! A mixture of slab and face climbing with tall routes. Bring lots of quick draws, some sunscreen and your 70m rope. (60m rope can work on "Handfuls of Happiness")

*We've added some routes on what we've dubbed The Upper Deck ledge, accessible from the first pitch of "Total Landscaping"
